title: Firefox sign in authentication credentials issue - loop of death on ebay
content:
There seems to always be issues with Firefox and ebay.co.uk again.

Last time this occurred, Firefox simply wouldn't browse products on ebay, failing to display. That seemed to have been picked up some time ago. I just moved over to Chrome until it was fixed.

Now we have problems again. This time, ebay recognises that I'm signed in, but when I do anything like try to add a product to my Watch List, I'm told to re-enter my password (or PassKey) but whatever I choose password or my PassKey, Firefox simply cycled back to the password screen.

I've attached a screenshot to show the screen I'm talking about. See attached.

When I move over to Chrome and follow the same process, everything works perfectly. Definitely a Firefox specific issue. As I have the same addons configured on both browsers, including my Keeper Password Manager.

This is a new issue since the last upgrade as I recall. The only change being the Firefox upgrade.

The current version is the latest for Mac - 131.0.3 (64 bit) on Monterey 12.7.6
creator: neil45

title: How to troubleshoot Firefox inhibiting system power saving functions?
content:
Earlier I noticed on a newly installed Debian (stable) system running Gnome (X11) that the screen was not blanking at all and thus the screen was not locking, neither was the system suspending.  After a while I found the command `gnome-session-inhibit --list` (and later the helpful Inhibition Indicator gnome extension ) which returned `firefox: video-playing (idle)`, indicating firefox was inhibiting the idle action (which is to blank the screen) due to playing a video.

Strange since there was no video playing. Mind you i do have several Firefox windows open in multiple workspaces comprising over 100 tabs on a good day. However, most of these tabs had gone to sleep or were forced to sleep by me with the Auto Tab Discard add-on. I didn't notice anything obvious in about:performance. ChatGPT said to try running `Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('video'))` in the console which returned an empty array. I thought that command checked every tab but it only applied to the tab I started the dev tools from. Maybe if there was a way to add a for loop to check all active tabs, it could be a useful command.

Since it was getting to the point I'd have to restart Firefox to fix this, I tried some more drastic measures first, like putting every tab to sleep with Auto Tab Discard. Now about:processes only listed core Firefox processes like: itself, Fork Server, Network, Utility, Extensions, 3x About Pages, and 3x Preallocated.  Even then firefox was still inhibiting the idle action! I think close all of the internals I just listed, so only "Firefox" was listed in about:performance, and still firefox was inhibiting the idle action!

Finally I closed Firefox and finally `gnome-session-inhibit --list` didn't list firefox anymore and screen started blanking again. So I guess that was a bug? How to troubleshoot that better and track down the cause? or should I just go ahead and post this already as a Firefox bug?

Thanks
creator: scarlion

title: Password Manager (Lack of) Security
content: I have appreciated Firefox for many years, so long in fact that I no longer have access to the email address that I signed up with. I have had no reason to access my account so I did not realise that it was out of date. I was accessing my account to check that I had two-factor protection and since I could not access the account I decided to create a new account and used the help pages to move my profile to the new account. I was able move my profile and access all my bookmarks and PASSWORDS! I simply uninstalled Firefox, moved my profile to another location, downloaded Firefox and copied the old profile over the newly created profile. I opened Firefox and could open the password manager and see all my passwords. I could not believe how easily I could access all the sensitive information. I needed no password - just access to the profile. This profile will be saved on any computer that I have used to log into Firefox. Anyone with access to those computers could easily repeat what I was able to do. This is a serious secuirty flaw and I simply can't believe I was able to do this!!!!!
creator: owen.brooker

title: Mac OS Firefox auto update (and even manual update difficulties)
content:
Hi all,

For the last week or two, (since version 1.30.x or so) my Mac running Sonoma (in aarch64) Firefox hasn't been able to update itself. Now I have no VPN causing woes (like Nord) I do however, use Adblocker Ultimate and Ghostery.

So I do the manual update, and find that the link doesn't "automatically start" the download. So I tell it to download manually with the big blue button... no dice.

So I copy the link location:

https://download.mozilla.org/?product=firefox-latest-ssl&os=osx&lang=en-US&attribution_code=c291cmNlPShub3Qgc2V0KSZtZWRpdW09KGRpcmVjdCkmY2FtcGFpZ249KG5vdCBzZXQpJmNvbnRlbnQ9KG5vdCBzZXQpJmV4cGVyaW1lbnQ9KG5vdCBzZXQpJnZhcmlhdGlvbj0obm90IHNldCkmdWE9ZmlyZWZveCZjbGllbnRfaWRfZ2E0PShub3Qgc2V0KSZzZXNzaW9uX2lkPShub3Qgc2V0KSZkbHNvdXJjZT1tb3pvcmc.&attribution_sig=abdb7ecea583af9de12c794aa139112efc9c10dbce0cd8382f668154ec651a81

If I open that up in a new tab... it STILL doesn't work. But as soon as I remove the last section:

.&attribution_sig=abdb7ecea583af9de12c794aa139112efc9c10dbce0cd8382f668154ec651a81

It downloads fine.

Incidentally, it downloads fine in all the other browsers (Brave, Safari, etc). Also the entire Mozilla support site, if accessed using Firefox, looks as though no CSS is ever loaded. It's been like that for days. Everything else works fine. Just Mozilla sites.

Is anyone else having this problem? It was updating fine until recently.
creator: Ham

title: Sync deleting extensions from old devices instead of installing to new ones
content:
I had to reinstall Firefox on laptop B. Initially I copied the profile folder back, as I had a recent backup. However, when I sync'd, it deleted a bunch of extensions - which then sync'd and deleted them from laptop A too.

I got them back (manually) on A, deleted the new installation on B, then reinstalled and resync'd (without copying the profile folder). Same thing happened, except as I wasn't coming from the profile, I'd also lost a bunch of settings. So even worse.

My theory (based on the popup about syncing with a mobile device) is it is, for some reason, syncing with my Android phone config (which doesn't have all the same extensions, as they're not compatible) instead of my browser on A.

Has anyone else encountered this? Any solutions?
